links.description: MICHAEL KRAMER AND THE CLIENTS OF MOTT CAPITAL OWN SHARES OF AAPL, SWKS Join our 807 Daily Subscribers And Get This FREE Commentary In Your E-Mail! The week of September 24 will be a busy one for stocks, with the FOMC decision on interest rates on Wednesday afternoon, revised second-quarter GDP on Thursday, and inflation data on Friday.

messages.body: $AAPL https://www.express.co.uk/life-style/science-technology/1021629/Apple-macOS-Mojave-update-release-imac-macbook/amp

links.title: macOS Mojave release TODAY - All the new features coming to you MacBook and iMac
links.description: Apple announced its new macOS Mojave upgrade back in June at its WWDC Developers Conference and this blockbuster update will be pushed out to Macs across the world today. There's a swathe of new additions and features in this new operating system including a stunning Dark Mode, Dynamic Desktop and the ability to instantly clean up your desktop with Stacks.

$AAPL China Cancels Trade Talks With U.S. -- Update https://www.morningstar.com/news/dow-jones/TDJNDN_201809219132/china-cancels-trade-talks-with-us-update.html

links.title: China Cancels Trade Talks With U.S. -- Update
links.description: By Lingling Wei China scotched trade talks with the U.S. that were planned for the coming days, according to people briefed on the matter, further dimming prospects for resolving a trade battle between the world's two largest economies. The decision to pull out of the talks follows the latest escalation in trade tensions.

links.title: Nike Remains the Dow's Top-Performing Stock
links.description: Nike retained its hold on first place as the best-performing Dow stock last week. The company's controversial ad campaign has been a solid success and a new world record in the marathon was posted by a runner wearing Nike shoes.

symbols.title: COMMUNICAT SVS SLCT SEC SPDR ETF

links.title: The stock market has just undergone a major transformation
links.description: After the bell Friday, around $2.8 trillion in equities reshuffled into the newly created communications services sector. Those changes leave the tech sector looking a little different to investors. "What's going to be left of the technology sector is going to be largely driven by the hardware and the software and services space," explained Lindsey Bell, investment strategist at CFRA Research, on CNBC's " Trading Nation" on Thursday.

links.title: US and China exchange new trade war blows as latest round of tariffs takes effect
links.description: Qilai Shen | Bloomberg | Getty Images The latest round of tariffs targeting U.S. and Chinese goods went into effect Monday, raising the stakes in an escalating trade war between the world's two largest economies.
